title.narrative: Livelihood Support for People Living With HIV/AIDS (LS4-PLWHA)

description.narrative: Lilongwe district is has one of the largest populations of people living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) in Malawi. UNAIDS estimates that 20 to 39.9 percent of pregnant women in Lilongwe district are sero-positive. At the national level, estimates show that the HIV/AIDS prevalence rate is 12 percent, translating into more than 930,000 PLWHAs. An estimated 850,000 children have been orphaned since the epidemic began leaving the responsibility to remaining family members. A needs identification exercise in the district found an increasing need to secure and provide nutritious food for PLWHAs and affected households. Improving food security and nutrition is a priority for such households, as this will ensure that their nutrition status is maintained, which is crucial for better quality of life, reducing susceptibility to illness and increasing productivity. The Livelihoods Support Project for People Living with HIV/AIDS and Affected Households in Lilongwe will work with organized community groups of PLWHAs and affected households in the areas of Traditional Authority Khongoni and Kabudula in Lilongwe district to improve food security and nutrition by providing training, agricultural inputs, livestock, and vegetable and agro-forestry tree seeds. The project will target 1,000 households—500 original and 500 through Heifer’s Pass on the Gift process—of PLWHAs and those caring for HIV/AIDS orphans in 10 different communities from the two traditional authorities in the district. Each of the 1,000 families will benefit from the placement of two goats (dairy or meat), vegetable and pasture seeds, and related training. The project will help ensure the availability of nutritious food in sufficient quantities, adequate quality and variety to meet demands at all times, achieve and sustain nutritional and health status through effective use of food at household and community levels, increase the adoption of improved animal husbandry practices and project values through education and training, and strengthen the community management capacities of food security and nutrition activities.
